result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan T. Zanow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan T. Zanow

defendant.name: Zanow, Ryan T.
defendant.address: 1711 Two Mile Avenue, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request from DOJ for Copies of Documents

Defendant Ryan T. Zanow in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:34 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Pay fine of $300 plus costs.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
(No DNA surcharge).

records.addlTxt: $1,000 sig bond:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Defendant Ryan T. Zanow in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
BTC:  $1,000 sig bond:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
